ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How are you feeling today compared to usual state
Notes: 1= much worse than usual; 2= worse than usual; 3= a little worse than usual; 4= neither better nor worse than usual; 5= a little better than usual; 6= better than usual; 7= much better than usual

ElementDescription: How are you usually compared to other people
Notes: 1= is always rather stable and even; 2= is generally higher; 3= is generally lower; 4= repeatedly shows periods of ups and downs

ElementDescription: High state 1- Need less sleep
High state 2- I feel more energetic and active
High state 3- I am more self-confident
High state 4- I enjoy work more
High state 5- I am more sociable
High state 6- I want to travel and/or do travel more
High state 7- I tend to drive faster or take more risks when driving
High state 8- I spend more money/ too much money
High state 9- I take more risks in daily life
High state 10- I am physically more active
High state 11- I plan more activities or projects
High state 12- I have more ideas, I am more creative
High state 13- I am less shy or inhibited
High state 14- I wear more colourful clothes/make-up
High state 15- I want to meet or actually meet more people
High state 16- I am more interested in sex
High state 17- I am more flirtatious or sexually active
High state 18- I talk more
High state 19- I think faster
High state 20- I make more jokes when talking
High state 21- I am more easily distracted
High state 22- I engage in new things
High state 23- My thoughts jump from topic to topic
High state 24- I do things more quickly/easily
High state 25- I am more impatient/irritable
High state 26- I can be exhausting/irritating to others
High state 27- I get into more quarrels
High state 28- My mood is higher/optimistic
High state 29- I drink more coffee
High state 30- I smoke more cigarettes
High state 31- I drink more alcohol
High state 32- I take more drugs
How frequently does the "high" describe how you are
Notes: 1= sometimes; 2= most of the time; 3= I never experience such a "high"

ElementDescription: Impact of the "high" on family life
Notes: 1= positive and negative; 2= positive; 3= negative; 4= no impact

ElementDescription: Impact of the "high" on social life
Notes: 1= positive and negative; 2= positive; 3= negative; 4= no impact

ElementDescription: Impact of the "high" on work
Notes: 1= positive and negative; 2= positive; 3= negative; 4= no impact

ElementDescription: Impact of the "high" on leisure
Notes: 1= positive and negative; 2= positive; 3= negative; 4= no impact

ElementDescription: How do people close to you react to "high"
Notes: 1= positively; 2= neutral; 3= negatively; 4= positively and negatively; 5= no reactions

ElementDescription: Length of "high" on average
Notes: 1= 1 days; 2= 2-3 days; 3= 4-7 days; 4= longer than 1 week; 5= longer than 1 month; 6= I can't judge/don't know

ElementDescription: Have you experienced such "highs" in the past 12 months (yes/no)
If yes, how many days did you spend in "highs" in last 12 months
Form used/assessment name
During that episode, how often were you: much more sociable or outgoing than usual?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often were you: much more involved than usual in thinking about or doing something sexual?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often did you: sleep much less than usual and still not get tired or sleepy?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often did you: talk so much that other people couldn?t get their say?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often did you: have thoughts race through your mind so fast you could hardly keep track of them?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often did you: get easily distracted by things around you or have a hard time concentrating on what you were doing?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often did you: make bad decisions or engage in reckless behavior that could have caused problems for you?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: What was the longest number of days in a row you ever had an episode of this sort?
Notes: 0= 2-3 days; 1= 4-6 days; 2= 7-14 days; 3= 15 or more days

ElementDescription: How much did episodes of this sort ever interfere with your activities at home, work, school, or in your social life?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= A little; 2= Some; 3= A lot; 4= Extremely

ElementDescription: How often during episodes of this sort did anyone notice or comment that you were much more energetic, wound up, productive, or outgoing than usual?
Were you ever hospitalized for one of these episodes?
About how old were you the very first time you had an episode of this sort lasting 2 days or longer?
About how many different years in your life did you have an episode of this sort lasting 2 days or longer?
Notes: Total number of years in lifetime

ElementDescription: About how many months in the past 12 did you have an episode of this sort?
Notes: Total number of months within the last year

ElementDescription: Did you have an episode of this sort at any time in the past 30 days?

During these episodes when your mood was much higher than usual most of the day, much more irritable than usual most of the day, or a mix of these things, people are often much more excitable than usual, extremely self-confident, or optimistic. They often do things they would normally not do. And this sometimes gets them in trouble or puts them at risk of trouble. With this definition in mind, did you ever in your life have an episode of this sort lasting 2 days or longer?

Think about a typical intense episode of this sort lasting 2 days or longer. How often during that episode did you have the following experience: You were in a much better mood, much happier, or much more excitable than usual
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: Think about a typical intense episode of this sort lasting 2 days or longer. How often during that episode did you have the following experience: You were much more irritable or quick to take offense than usual
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: Think about a typical intense episode of this sort lasting 2 days or longer. How often during that episode did you have the following experience: You were a lot more self-confident or optimistic than usual or believed you could do anything
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often were you: much more active or energetic than usual?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often were you: much more hyper or wound up than usual?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: During that episode, how often were you: much more engaged, busy, or productive than usual at school or work?
Notes: 0= None of the time; 1= A little of the time; 2= Some of the time; 3= Most of the time; 4= All or almost all of the time

ElementDescription: Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Eating disorder (e.g., anorexia, bulimia, binge eating disorder)?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Problems with anger control?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Problems with alcohol or drug use?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Any other serious problem with your emotions or mental health?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Episodes of depression lasting 2 weeks or longer?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Panic/anxiety attacks?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Phobias (i.e., extreme fears of specific objects or situations)?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: PTSD (post-traumatic stress disorder)?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Generalized anxiety disorder (i.e., being very worried and anxious for several months or longer)?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: Mania, manic depression, or bipolar disorder?
Did you ever in your life have any of the following problems with your mental or emotional health: ADHD or ADD (attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder)?
During this period of time were you more active than usual?
During this period of time were you engaging in risky behavior like spending sprees, driving recklessly or sexual indiscretions?
Did these symptoms last at least a week and cause you significant problems at home, work, at school, or were you ever hospitalized for these problems?
Have you had these symptoms for at least a week during the last month?
Timepoint/visit label

Have you ever had a period of a week or more when you were feeling so good, 'high', excited, or 'on top of the world' that other people thought you were not your normal self; or have you have a period of a week or more when you were feeling persistently irritable, angry, or short-tempered for most of the day, ever day? (Clarifiers: When you were feeling high or on top of the world, was that more than just feeling good? When you were feeling irritable or angry, was that different from the way you usually are? Do not consider times when you were using drugs or alcohol.) If no, stop and answer no. If yes, continue. Did you also feel like you were hyper or wired and had an unusual amount of energy or were you much more active than is typical for you? (Clarifier: Did other people comment on how much you were doing?) All have to be yes to answer yes.
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 9 = Missing; if no to this question, assessment is complete and remaining questions are not asked

ElementDescription: During this period of time were you feeling that you were an especially important person?
During this period of time were you needing less sleep than usual?
During this period of time were you talking too much without stopping or so fast that people had a hard time understanding you?
During this period of time were you having thoughts racing through your head?
During this period of time were you easily distracted?
